questions.question: What UNESCO World Heritage Site in Peru was once the heart of the Inca Empire and features the famous citadel on a mountain ridge?
questions.context: This site is renowned for its sophisticated dry-stone construction that fuses huge blocks without the use of mortar.

questions.question: What UNESCO World Heritage Site in Egypt, built during the reign of Pharaoh Khufu, is the last standing wonder of the ancient world?
questions.context: Constructed during the Fourth Dynasty, this pyramid was the tallest man-made structure in the world for more than 3,800 years.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in India is famously known for its intricate carvings and erotic sculptures, representing a celebration of love and life?
questions.context: These temples, built during the Chandela dynasty, are a prime example of architectural symbolism and have been admired for centuries.

questions.question: In Italy, what UNESCO World Heritage Site is renowned for its Leaning Tower, which began tilting during its construction in the 12th century?
questions.context: The iconic tilt of the tower is due to an unstable foundation and soft soil, which remains a mystery in civil engineering.

questions.question: Which historic site in Germany was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its exquisite Baroque architecture, originally commissioned by Augustus the Strong?
questions.context: This cultural landmark was heavily damaged in World War II but has since been meticulously restored to reflect its former grandeur.
